p: Confluence is designed as “possible connections for strengthening trajectories, a lesson learned from the waters as they expand their courses in flow and power when they meet” by Antônio Bispo dos Santos, a Brazilian intellectual of a Quilombola traditional community (Santos 2015). The environmental sociologist Ashish Kothari also adopts the term in a similar sense, in the context of the “Global Tapestry of Alternatives” and “Radical Ecological Democracy” networks (Kothari et al. 2019).
